intro: Couepia grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered couepia, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture, adding to its ornamental appeal.
